{{also|euro|euró|eŭro|euro-|Euro-}} ==English== {{wikipedia}} ===Adjective=== {{en-adj}} # {{clipping of|en|European}} ===Noun=== {{en-noun|s|Euro}} # {{lb|en|proscribed}} {{alternative spelling of|en|euro|nodot=true}}, the currency and coin introduced 1999. # {{lb|en|soccer|usually followed by the year}} The [[w:UEFA European Football Championship|UEFA European Football Championship]], a European football competition held between the international teams of Europe every four years. #* {{quote-journal |en |date=June 19, 2012 |author=Phil McNulty |title=England 1-0 Ukraine |work=BBC Sport |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18181971 |page= |passage=England could have met world and European champions Spain but that eventuality was avoided by Sweden's 2-0 win against France, and Rooney's first goal in a major tournament since scoring twice in the 4-2 victory over Croatia in Lisbon at '''Euro''' 2004.}} # {{clipping of|en|European}} {{rfex|en}} ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # A ghost town in [[Western Australia]]. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=eoru|ouer|roué|ureo-}} [[Category:en:Currencies]] [[Category:en:European Union]] [[Category:en:Western Australia]] ---- ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈɔʏ̯ʁoː/|[ˈʔɔʏ̯ʁoː]}} * {{audio|de|De-Euro.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Euros|Euro|pl2=Euros}} # [[euro]] {{gloss|currency}} #: {{ux|de|Ich habe nur noch fünf '''Euro''' in meinem Portmonee.|t=I just have five '''euro''' in my purse.}} #: {{ux|de|Gestern habe ich zwei '''Euro''' gefunden.|t=Yesterday i found two '''euro.'''}} ====Usage notes==== * The difference between the plurals ''Euro'' and ''Euros'' is equivalent to the difference between [[pence]] and [[pennies]] in English: The unchanged plural is used to mean an amount or value, whereas ''Euros'' may be used when referring to a number of coins. However, the unchanged plural can be used for the latter meaning as well. * A third plural {{m|de|Euronen}} is restricted to jocular use (based on such pairs as {{m|de|Pharao}} → {{m|de||Pharaonen}}). Rarely, a new singular {{m|de|Eurone}} {{g|m}}, {{g|f}} may be backformed. ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Teuro}} [[Category:de:Currencies]] ---- ==Portuguese== ===Proper noun=== {{pt-proper noun|m}} # {{lb|pt|Greek god}} {{l|en|Eurus}} {{gloss|god of the east wind}}
